import React, { Component } from 'react'; import './project.css' import { Tabs, Tab, Grid, Cell, Card, CardTitle, CardText, CardActions, Button, CardMenu, IconButton} from 'react-mdl'; import Danne from '../assets/danne.jpg' import Amsterdam from '../assets/test.png' import PatrikHogler3 from '../assets/putte2.png'; class Project extends Component { constructor(props) { super(props); { this.state = { activeTab: 0 } } } toggleCategories() { if(this.state.activeTab === 0) { return (
{/* Project 1 */} Dantrick Built in React as Frontend and Wordpress as Backend. Master thesis from my time in KYH Stockholm. {/* Project 2 */} Patrik Hogler - Portfolio V3.0 My own portfolio site. Built in React.js with Material Design.
) } else if (this.state.activeTab === 1){ return (
{/* Project 1 */} Den glada geten A basic dynamic bed & breakfast site there you could read about the business. And make a room reservation or book an activity. Admin section to update the content. {/* Project 2 */} Patrik Hogler - Portfolio V 1.0 My first ever made dynamic portfolio site. Built in HTML/CSS and JavaScript {/* vetly */} Vetly A team school project were we built a veteinary portal, there you could read about the business and make a booking with a vet through a calender. Built with HTML/CSS, JavaScript and very basic react.
) } else if (this.state.activeTab === 2){ return (
{/* Patrik Hogler - Wordpress */} Patrik Hogler - Portfolio V 2.0 I took my first portfolio site from previous project and converted it into a WordPress theme.

this.setState({ activeTab: tabId })} ripple> React HTML/CSS + JS + PHP Wordpress

Have a look of my projects

Here you can see some projects I have worked with. Most of them are from my Front End education. Navigate through the tab to see which languages ​​the projects are written in. I'm learning everyday and i will keep continue to post projects as soon as they are done.
